website_summaries.verdict: The ProSensor uses multiple sensors to find both the center and edges. It works best with standard drywall, but can also penetrate plaster and wood paneling.
pros: Bright visual display, not just audio
cons: Doesn't work well on materials other than drywall

customer_reviews.title: No better than cheap stud finder
customer_reviews.text: Like many people that purchased this product I was on the hunt for a reliable stud finder to replace the standard $30 junk units. I thought I could throw some money at my dilemma. This thing will work some of the time but it produces inaccurate results about 75% of the time. Now I'm using two crappy stud finders for each stud, hoping that their results overlap and I can reduce the chances of missing the stud yet again. Waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Go Fund Me, Instead...
customer_reviews.text: No more accurate than a $10 one. Just more lights. Missed the studs (2 times) despite carefully reviewed instructions. My $10 stud finder was just as "accurate," gave the same exact reading both places. Stud finders are stud finders. Nothing new or time saving here. If you have an extra $30 to blow, just send it to me. You'll be no worse for the wear.
customer_reviews.author: OlderWiserReader

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I was waiting a long time to get a stud finder and finally got this model. Seemed like it was top rated among various sites. But all I can say is how disappointed I am. When I use it as instructed it just would keep random lights on or all the lights then suddenly no lights. So either my walls are solid wood, structural air, or are made of tree branches that are blowing in the wind in my walls. Because this thing did not find a single stud properly. And no AC detection also is a let down
customer_reviews.author: Captain Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Having a stud finder that does not need calibrated is a real time saver for me. I just pull it out of my tool belt push the button and get to work. I'm a trim carpenter and nail boards on the for a living. The only downside to the stud finder is the room it takes up in my belt, and the fact that the three LEDs marking a single stud are not always dead center. But it's absolutely close enough 4 shooting brad's. If you're looking for a fast-acting stud finder, this is the ticket. Even picks up the metal studs in my trailer behind the 1/4" ply.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not as depicted
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had time to return this but my project was already held up waiting for this. Works well as a detector of wood studs soo far, which is mission one. Disappointed that it clearly stated "Built-in Bubble level" and even showed a picture with the level on it. But the one sent to me did not have a bubble level which would allow me to score a leveling line on the wall while using it without needing to take out a second tool. Minus one star for inaccurate listing of an otherwise 5 star tool.
customer_reviews.author: Qwkzotc

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in one job
customer_reviews.text: I had to install a grab bar on ceramic tile in the master bathroom. No second chances, no "test holes." This sensor found the stud quickly and accurately, with no false readings, where my cheapo stud finder failed. Through tile! I don't care if it now crumbles into dust. It probably saved my marriage and prevented a broken hip.
customer_reviews.author: FlayrodWeasel

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well.
customer_reviews.text: Did not find stud accurately. The best is the ones I've found are the ones with the magnet in the end that hangs on to a drywall screw. No fooling a magnet. Much cheaper and hangs on the wall while you work. Sometimes technology is not better than simple and functional.
customer_reviews.author: James Schornagel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with this stud finder.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in 2014 and used it a few times with varying success. I never felt confident whether it was reading a stud or a pipe in the wall. I mothballed it shortly thereafter, taking out the batteries, and tried using it the other day (in 2020) and it was dead. I saw this item (it was a different color) in a large discount store for $29.99 but was not tempted to get it even at that price. I think I have best luck finding studs in the wall with my knuckle and a small nail. That's what my full-time carpenter employee does too.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Heilig

customer_reviews.title: Works soo much better then the other ones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a well known brand of stud finder that was actually impossible to use. Everything would trigger it and AC was present everywhere. I literally stuck a flex camera in the wall to verify and as expected there was no AC or pipes anywhere despite what the stud finder was reporting. This one on the other hand works great, it finds the discrepancies instantly and very accurately. There’s no AC detection which I like because it doesn’t work anyways. Besides, anytime something goes through a stud there should be a metal plate affixed to the end of the stud that should clue you in.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap a stud finder that actually works for me
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap a stud finder that actually works for me. This is excellent and totally worth it. There are studs that don't have screws in them, for example in tight spaces like a closet where they only screwed the drywall on either side but not in the middle because there wasn't a structural need for the ~2ft wide piece. Most studs will span 3 of the dots, so you can really trust that middle one to be +/- 0.2 inches of actual center of the stud. 2 AA batteries very easy to put in. Not much to it, just put it up against the wall and squeeze the button, move it around.
customer_reviews.author: C.K.

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Extremely accurate and will locate studs even through the thickest drywall. Product is large. This is a good thing. Designed to not scratch the surface of whatever you are moving it across. Locate studs fast and shows you not only the location of the stud but how wide the stud actually is. Bright LED lights indicate everything you need to know. Long lasting battery. Blows away the cheapo products from competitors. If you want to do things right this is the product to use. It will save you a lot of frustration by being accurate.
customer_reviews.author: FixingStuff

customer_reviews.title: Highly accurate stud finder
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is very easy to use based on the instructions on the product itself. You hold it against the wall, press.and hold the button on it, and slide it left or right and watch for the lights to indicate a stud location. My go-to stud finder is still a small magnetic one for speed/convenience, but since that only tells me where screws are located, the Franklin sensor is more accurate in indicating the full width of the stud. For something like mounting my heavy TV, I want to make sure I'm centered in the stud and not barely catching the edge of it, so this is what I turn to.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: 100% accuracy eliminates guesswork
customer_reviews.text: My son recommended this stud finder to me and I am glad he did. After using a more traditional model for many years that identifies the edge of a stud and not very well imo (sometimes the edges appear to be 8 inches apart other times it appears that there is only one edge to the stud so you still end up guessing where to drive the nail/screw.) this one identifies with 100% accuracy both edges and the all elusive middle. Highly recommend for any homeowner who has a heavy object to hang on a wall and doesn’t want a lot of “test” holes to hide (almost everyone). This stud finder eliminates all of the guesswork!
customer_reviews.author: skibo

customer_reviews.title: AA Batteries versus 9V
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it only because it uses AA batteries versus 9 volt. This is the kind of tool where you might go long periods without using it and nothing is worse than going to use a tool and finding AA batteries have leaked and ruined the device. I'd rather have a 9 volt battery. I've never had a 9 volt leak ruining a tool. I've had several tools ruined from AA's leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Dude, one of the best stud finders PERIOD!
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been all my life? The ProSensor 710 is one of the easiest, quickest, most ergonomic, and user-friendly stud finders I have ever used. I appreciate that the ACTIVATE/ON button is inline with your wrist for whatever direction you're scanning your wall in. But the piece de resistance is definitely the LEDs that clearly show you how wide each stud is, and then you can use the ruler at the top to mark the center more accurately. The only thing missing that it can't read/display is electrical lines, so you might need another device for that purpose. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: GearUP with Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the wimpy ones!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many things for stud finding over the years--tapping my knuckle, tapping a pencil eraser, Zircon StudSensor e50, Zircon StudSensor Pro. This is by far the easiest. Remember that no stud finder is 100% since they work by sensing changes in density. But the ProSensor is the best I've used to date. It's larger than the Zircons. It has LED lights across its width than show the width of the stud. Many other stud finders show the edge of the stud then you have to drag it in the opposite direction to find the other edge. The LEDs illuminate to show the entire width of the stud with the initial pass. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bradbury

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Found this at Menards for less then half the price on Amazon. It also doesn’t work on plaster and lattice (metal grid behind plaster with a 1930’s house). But I knew that would probably be the case. Had it sort-of help a few times, surprisingly enough.
customer_reviews.author: TamusJRoyce

customer_reviews.title: Better than most stud finders
customer_reviews.text: The no-frills display is a winner with me. It gets the information to me clearly. Just what I need while getting work done. I have found the size to occasionally be a problem in tight areas and on curved walls. When this happens I've needed to get out the old smaller palm-size finder. Most of the time, this is my go-to stud finder because it gets job done faster and more reliably than any other stud finder that I've used.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I really wish I had purchased this earlier
customer_reviews.text: I got a cheaper stud finder years ago - the kind you have to slide along the wall to locate studs. I wish I had saved my money and purchased this instead. Wow, this is super-easy, very accurate, and very repeatable. I used it to locate an outside hose spigot pipe and studs recently. It very easily "showed" both the copper pipe and the studs. Made the job so much smoother. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: N. Dured

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one and you'll toss your current one/won't even think to buy another!
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is the real deal! I needed to mount a TV wall mount and replace my 2-hole heavy bag mount with a 4-hole one. The other stud finders I've used in the past were so hit or miss (mostly miss), but after reading the glowing reviews for this one, I decided to buy it. I can tell you that the other 5 star reviews are just as accurate as this device! The multiple LED lights upon detecting a stud are incredible and will save you so much time and effort drilling holes/hammering nails as the lights don't lie! Look no further for a true stud finder!
customer_reviews.author: A. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Can give erroneous readings.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool. However, occasionally it will give an erroneous reading, indicating that there is a stud behind the wall when there is none. I was installing three brackets to support handrails in the stairways in my house. Two studs were located easily, the third was not at the location indicated by the stud finder but several inches away. The stud finder may have been picking up pipes in a pipe chase a couple of inches behind the wall.
customer_reviews.author: emoryboy

customer_reviews.title: Must Get
customer_reviews.text: This is a must get tool if you plan to do any type of wall hanging. I've used stud finders in the past, but many times they're inaccurate or just simply confusing to use. The Franklin is simple to use, shows the width of the stud so I can locate the middle easily and fast. Using it is also intuitive unlike other stud finders where I had to dig out instructions to see what the different indicators meant. May be a little pricey but definitely worth.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade to cheaper models.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to locate studs through siding to install two door canopies. I first located the studs on the inside wall, and then tried the outside wall. Worked great on the inside wall, but only located half the studs on the outside wall, which is understandable, since it had to penetrate vinyl bevel siding, 1/4" foam and 3/4" pine wood siding, over the studs. Much easier and more accurate to use than normal locators with one sensor, so it's worth the price. I couldn't justify paying even more to get a more sensitive type of locator.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix-it

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the cheaper units i have used. I am putting up 5/8” plywood, and they were useless on that. This one is much better. It sometimes gives a false reading on knots in the plywood core. Easily overcome by moving up or down the stud. Only gripe is it could have a better grip area. It is easy to drop and the cover pops off and batteries fall out. Minor issue, but it works! I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: leslie w. coburn

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder by far
customer_reviews.text: Moves easily along the wall. Identifies the entire wall stud rather than just one side so don't have to relocate the finder to identify other side of stud. Size and handle make it much more user friendly. Have not used my old stud finder since this one arrived. When installing base trim (on my knees) it identifies the entire width of the stud immediately so I can just power nail as I move along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great sliding it around the wall and seeing 3 lights ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised just how much I prefer this to previous stud finders. It's great sliding it around the wall and seeing 3 lights come on for every stud! What I've learned to do: Slide it very slowly to the left, and draw a line at the left-most point where it shows a light. Do the same thing to the right. Insert nails/screws right at the midpoint between those two lines. Otherwise, you can end up on the edge of a stud.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in KY

customer_reviews.title: These do not work on plaster-and-lathe.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older 1940’s town home. This device may work on drywall, but seems useless for older plaster-and-lathe construction...
customer_reviews.author: B to the G

customer_reviews.title: Works even with tricky double-thick drywall
customer_reviews.text: My house was built in the 1950s; the drywall was nailed in place and then a second sheet of drywall was glued over the nailed down sheet. I guess the builder was experimenting with this then-new material instead of plaster. This double-thick drywall has proved impossible to other stud finders, but this Franklin did the job. I'm very impressed. It's effortless to find not just the edge of a stud but the center. Quality product, with the extra cost when securing into studs matters.
customer_reviews.author: Travis P

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best Stud finder money can by
customer_reviews.text: I bought the top of the line stud finder at home depot and it consistently gave me inaccurate results. I returned that flawed piece of garbage and bought this and I couldnt be happier. Works better than any stud finder they have available at homedepot.
customer_reviews.author: Morris

customer_reviews.title: Finally a stud finder tha actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Nearly all stud finders I've used have been complete junk. Now I've got plaster walls and they're worthless so I tried this and it works perfectly. It's been right every single time and because of the width has found some studs I didn't even expect to exist (old house with a few quirks). Simply buy this stud finder and you won't need another.
customer_reviews.author: W. Odom

customer_reviews.title: Great tech when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Why can't a little quality be put into products? The tech of the unit is great....it finds and locates studs easily, but after a few uses the batteries either don't make contact or the switch is faulty....its open the case, wiggle the batteries, and hope it stays lite to locate a stud....very disappointed...I was willing to pay the price, but I thought it would serve me for more than a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Griswold

customer_reviews.title: One finder to rule them all
customer_reviews.text: I'm just going to echo what others have said: This is the one that works. Over the years, I have tried 3-4 finders from home stores, and found the simple magnetic Studpop to be better than all of them. I was unable to resist the lure of another gadget however, so I tried this one, and I'm hitting the studs dead-center every time, no hunting or probing needed. I'm happy now. The Studs of Evil can no longer hide from the forces of light.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: bulky
customer_reviews.text: works great. sometimes more than 3 lights blink, sometimes it's 5 blinking inconsistantly... but you KNOW you got a stud when there's 3. Buying one for a friend (he's a contractor and has a crappy one). 1 star off because of it's size. Perhaps it can't be smaller due to the large amount of sensors. Takes up a ton of space in my toolbelt, and that's a problem. This works so well I'd pay twice as much if they could reduced the size by half.
customer_reviews.author: PixelPusher

customer_reviews.title: Erratic
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder had great difficulty finding studs behind the only wall we needed it to work for. It "detected" studs at such irregular and unrealistic intervals that we had no choice but to send it back as the unit was clearly having problems with the readings. Perhaps this thing works better in ideal conditions but it failed the real-world test. Unfortunately, while it seems like the easiest to use and most convenient stud-finder out there, it doesn't seems to be able to detect much of anything. It either displayed nothing or went off like crazy everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Col. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: This is "the best" stud finder I have ever used hands down. I tore out some carpeting and padding in our master bedroom. We had tons of floor squeeks and I need to fond where the underlying floor joists were. This stud finder was so powerful it actually located the joists thru 5/8 OSB/ Amazing device!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Langan

customer_reviews.title: The best stud finder I have used and I have used a few.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to skip the cheap units and go for one that was well reviewed and I must say I am not disappointed. The only reason for the four star is on any wall with filling it seems like it is not as accurate or gives false readings completely. Mainly walls on the outer rim of the house. That being said on interior walls it is completely accurate. On doing work on the inside or simply hanging pictures it has never been wrong. I have found myself using it more than I thought I would because it is so accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: The best stud-finder I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: When used inside, the device pinpoints studs very easily. The outside walls have concrete siding and I wanted to mount a heavy piece of equipment to them. My previous finder could not penetrate the siding so was useless. This device found one stud with reliability and I was able to measure to the two adjacent studs. it paid for itself on its first usage.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a simple man
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I'm not a handyman and have a fairly simple set of tools that I use around the house. I usually watch online videos of how to do certain things, like seal tile or hang a mirror. This tool is amazing. My previous device required me to slide it along the wall and wait for it to beep. This device is so much easier to use and more accurate. It takes what was typically 1-3 minutes to find the stud with my old device down to about 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I hate dragging a small "typical" electric stud finder across the wall, they're narrow and keeping the button pressed down is a pain while moving it. This stud finder is easier to slide across the wall and faster. But pin-pointing the center of the stud is not as accurate. So if I'm planning to mount something heavy to a stud then I end up using the other kind of finder in order to get a true center. So it's a mixed bag... depending on what you need out of a stud finder. I'm perfectly ok with having a few around.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Worked only the first time
customer_reviews.text: It worked like a charm the first time. But slowly it started picking up blinking the lights randomly inspite of no studs... And i have checked various locations where i have 3 inch studs however, it was only showing 1.5 inch... Couldnt rely on this. Not sure if this was just a defective piece i have got.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Kind of great!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stud finder. It is SO MUCH BETTER than the top of the line Zircon one, which I threw in the trash in frustration. The same wall where the Zircon wouldn't work at all, the Franklin works perfectly and instantly. While I was ordering this one, I also bought a small magnetic stud finder, just in case. The magnetic one works but you have to find a nail, sometimes a chore. I love the Franklin one!
customer_reviews.author: A_user

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and wished I got it earlier instead of using other stud finders. It finds studs like a kid finds dirt. Easy to use and recommend going with the middle LED light when 3 lights are lit up. Made installing TV mounts so much easier. Wish it would have a built in leveler to make things easier than it already is. Highly recommend to anyone who is tired of using old traditional stud finders.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, no electrical or pipe check mode
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome for finding studs and joists. It's much easier to use than a normal stud finder, especially while in an awkward position, or on top of a ladder. However, it just finds dense objects. It doesn't warn you about wires or pipes. So you need to use some common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Doke Scott

customer_reviews.title: Out standing an awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This was by far the best item i have bought . You can trust the reading . The 3 lights that show the stud simple mark the middle one thats the middle of the stud ... No more woring about catching the edge of the stud . Or trying quess where the middle is at . I have used it to set up multiple shelfs in my garage with soon as the screw goes thru the sheetrock you no you hit a sold stud Awesome
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG L BLOCKER

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm putting new siding on my house, and this stud finder is a real time saver. This thing allows me to find studs about 5x faster than using the one that just has a single indicator. First of all I don't have to hunt around for the borders of the stud. Secondly, because this has many indicators, and I can see the width of the stud, I'm more confident that what I'm seeing is really a stud, and not a knot, or some other object behind the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hansel

customer_reviews.title: Miracle stud sensor.
customer_reviews.text: This is a miracle stud sensor. For many years I have owned a Zircon stud sensor, which unfortunately has never worked right no matter what I did. One day I got fed up and figured I would splurge on a good one. I got this ProSensor which I am impressed with and incredibly happy with. This sensor doesn't need to go through a "calibration cycle" like most other sensors. Instead, you just place it on the wall and hit the button. No sliding necessary. With three LED dots (on 2 inch studs), it will show you the two outer edges and the middle of the stud in one very simple step. I'm glad I got this stud sensor. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Research it.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Item came highly recommended from a well-known carpenter, but unfortunately doesn’t work. Read the “trouble shooting” section of the instructions and figured perhaps I was just using old batteries that have been in my drawer too long, nope. Put new batteries in it, still doesn’t work. I believe it’s a good product if you can find one that works.
customer_reviews.author: Nate the Great

customer_reviews.title: Works great on new construction
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s just me, but I can never get traditional stud finders to work properly. I get a different reading every time. I’ve been waiting for someone to come up with something like this! Bought this when we moved into a new built house and it works fantastically well. I needed to make sure I was able to securely mount a TV to the wall, and this made it a one person job. I will say that it doesn’t work well on Lathe and plaster walls which the instructions freely admit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Has the Quality
customer_reviews.text: Many moons ago, I bought a cheapo stud finder at one of the big box stores. It worked sorta kinda well enough, but I never had much confidence in it. Given that I had a job where it was pretty important to have that confidence, I upgraded to this one. Not disappointed. I really like the LEDs that show you the width and center of the studs. It also worked through a wood roofing material (like 1/4").
customer_reviews.author: Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Best Stud Finder Ever
customer_reviews.text: Just moved into new house and had lots of need for an accurate stud finder. This one did not fail one time. Every single time is was perfect. It is so easy to use and determine where the center of the stud is. No more guessing. There is none better. Love this stud finder.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked the first time
customer_reviews.text: Had completely given up on stud finders until I got this one. I had tried the regular ones (cheaper) which never ever worked reliably - too many false positives and false negatives - in other words they were not useful. This had made me avoid doing any kind of work that required drilling holes in walls. This tool on the other hand is reliable enough that I can take on those tasks without worry.
customer_reviews.author: S S

customer_reviews.title: FINDS BEAMS IN NO TIME👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to do it I didn’t want to put out the money for this but I have bought several that did not work and lo and behold I read the reviews so I bought it and guess what it worked I have been installing California closets throughout my house and this device was extremely helpful I don’t know what I would have done without it
customer_reviews.author: BAJON222

customer_reviews.title: One can almost determine the exact width of the wood ...
customer_reviews.text: One can almost determine the exact width of the wood or metal structure behind the wall by using this tool.. So, it greatly enhances you chances of correct placement of your fasteners (or drilling). They also sell optional cases for tool, should you so desire one..
customer_reviews.author: Truism

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work so well on older "Hard Rock" walls.
customer_reviews.text: I sent this back, I'm sure it works great on 1/2 modern drywall, but it was very spotty on my 3/4 older "hard rock" from the 40's, (Not latch & Plaster) and the readings were inconsistent. Thank You Amazon Prime! I just put it back in the package & box, got the online return post tag... and a few days later got my credit. Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.author: Buddha-head Steve

customer_reviews.title: Its works exactly as advertised.  No hassles - simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: For an review - this will be short and sweet. I purchased the Yellow one. It works exactly as you would expect. it works very well. Used on many many walls and ceilings, and it depicts the location AND width of any boards behind the sheetrock. This is, without a doubt, the best one I have ever bought - and I have three different kinds of these things - and this has the least amount of features (that I don't need to use now) - and works the best.
customer_reviews.author: ForrestA

customer_reviews.title: If you do any remodeling...buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I've spent years trying to find studs using other methods. This takes all the guesswork out. Plus it finds about any change in density behind about any type of surface. For instance it will find a stud behind a tiled surface or a ceiling joist above a stomped ceiling. I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Carr

customer_reviews.title: Great product... Till it breaks
customer_reviews.text: Disregarding some of the very few negative reviews, I decided to purchase this product. It worked flawlessly, and was the best stud finder I owned... for about 4 months (the warranty only lasts for 3). After this, despite having done -literally nothing- to it between now and the last time I used it (and keeping it stored in an indoor climate controlled environment), it's now completely dead. Buyer beware- it would seem that there are quality control issues with this product, which is shameful given its price.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This tool works perfectly in my suburban 8-year-old home to detect wood studs behind sheetrock. It is much better than my old stud finder that "beeps when it is over a stud" and requires you to mark the "edges" as you pass over the stud from the left and right until you narrow down onto each edge.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: So easy: slide along the wall and watch 3 lights track the stud you're passing by
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use, and gives more more reliable results than my knocking on walls and listening for the hollow echo. It's earned its place in my tool bag. The only problem I have had: it can't read near a corner because the tool is so wide it can't get into the corner (for example, when looking for studs in a closet to hang shelves).
customer_reviews.author: Jim Valerio

customer_reviews.title: This thing is the bee's knees
customer_reviews.text: Best stud finder I ever owned. It doesn't do wiring like some others, but I don't really care. I just need to know where the studs are. Once I know that I can cut an inspection hole to find the other stuff. The device is fast and plenty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: TRB

customer_reviews.title: Finally, stud finder that works
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many different stud finder and always make many unnecessary holes. This finder allow quick visual view of start and end of each stud. Much easier than most stud finder where I need to mark start/end of each stud. This stud finder still pretty reliable with insulation. It does get confused sometime if there are electrical wires but not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Finally a decent stud finder!
customer_reviews.text: Most stud finders are mediocre at best. They give false readings more often than true readings. This one does not need calibration and its LED strip really helps filter out the junk signals. I use this in conjunction with the magnet for better results. The magnet gives a good starting position and helps you filter out the junk. It's not perfect but it is a hundred times better than the 1990's stud finders.
customer_reviews.author: tooljunkie

customer_reviews.title: Fast, easy, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Like most every reviewer you'll read on here, the Franklin Sensor works great for me and is well worth the additional dollars compared to the cheap ones you find in big box stores. I've used it to find studs behind double-thick drywall, plaster, plywood... it works on basically everything. Any wall where it's had trouble was so odd in construction that really no stud sensor would have been able to do better. Definitely a worthwhile investment if you have to find studs quickly and reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart N.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a stud finder that you can trust.
customer_reviews.text: This is the one of the best purchases I’ve ever made. I’ve bought the pieces of inaccurate junk stud finders before I ended up with this. It costs twice the price of the other junk stud finders sod out there but worth it due to actually being able to trust it finding studs. Buy this and stop making unnecessary holes in your walls.
customer_reviews.author: Mike King

customer_reviews.title: Best. Studfinder. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use, there is no calibration required. Just put it up against the wall and turn on the button, and 3 lights will appear where the stud is. It's really that simple. I also have a Zircon edge stud finder and a Zircon center stud finder, but each gives me false positives sometimes, and I don't like that I have to move it along the wall to find the stud. This Franklin ProSensor finds the stud without having to slide across the wall.
customer_reviews.author: PhilipHS

customer_reviews.title: repeatable results, easy to use, best stud finder I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I am busy putting in baseboards and shelving in a workshop. I have put in over 100 nails and screws through 1/2" sheet rock and this device has identified the stud every time. I have used it on smooth and textured sheet rock finishes. It is absolutely the best stud finder when installing baseboard. I saw it being used on youtube by a professional trim carpenter and decided to give it a try. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Singleton

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! When opening, it feels a bit light for the price (feels like an 'entry-level' stud finder) but it works great! Slide it GENTLY AND SLOW-ISH over the wall and you can see where the objects in wall are. If you move too quickly it isn't as accurate but that's normal operation. This found pipes in the plumbing wall, as well as double and triple studs in the support wall. We checked it on known stud locations and it was really accurate. Found hidden studs and we checked for accuracy on that wall too. Works great. Won't be going back to the old type of stud finder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Robin hood accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Just hung a pretty heavy flat screen TV on wall using this. Was first use so I also tested accuracy by probing with a finishing nail. I think i hit deadcenter of stud. The 1/4” screws are holding tightly, i am confident in device. I hope it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Snotter

customer_reviews.title: Works on 1950-era plaster & rock lath walls, and it's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This works on my 1950-era plaster & rock lath walls, and it's easy to use. On walls such as mine, you might want to explore the wall a bit. I noticed that this device can initially show red lights all over the place; however, running it a second time from top down will show an accurate line of the stud. Fwiw, the following device is the first stud finder I purchased which, unfortunately, did not work on my type of walls:
customer_reviews.author: 🥇Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder may cost 3 times as much as the stud finders you find in the big box hardware stores, but for me, it has been worth every penny. I've been adding some shelving and this stud finder is very quick and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: JStreet

customer_reviews.title: Yeah it really is that good.
customer_reviews.text: I had a project were I needed to anchor ceiling joists to support 200lb. Getting lag screws on target was absolutely critical. I made some attempts predrilling holes using my old POS stud finder and missed more than I hit. I read reviews on the ProSensor finder and figured it could do the trick. It did. The finder is relatively expensive but I believe it to be a good value given it's accuracy and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few cheap stud finders in my life and they end up causing more guess work than accurate sensing. I assumed all stud finders were similar to divining rods or Ouija Boards. But I got this one for Christmas and it has been a revelation. It works flawlessly and accurately. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Eliot Martin

customer_reviews.title: Most Accurate One I Have Used
customer_reviews.text: This device shows you exactly where the stud is in the wall. As you move it across the wall the LED's light up over the stud showing it's exact location. My cabinet maker liked it so much I bought him one. None better.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Lavrouhin

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: When using a stud finder in a really old house, you have to know what the stud finder is reading. We mounted a 55" TV above our fireplace and this made it so much easier. If you're unsure of what the stud finder is reading, move it up or down. If its a stud it will not disappear. Absolutely love this purchase and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Rage

customer_reviews.title: I really like that you don't have to calibrate it when you ...
customer_reviews.text: If you work with stud finders all the time you know that they can be a PIA when it comes to locating the center of a stud consistently... this product takes the guess work out... if there is a light - you have something solid behind the wall... does not indicate AC or metal. I really like that you don't have to calibrate it when you turn it on - works as soon as you press the button - even if you started off the wall...
customer_reviews.author: TJ C

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the most intuitive stuff finder I have ever used. I have 2 of the zircon models and I like them ok... but this is tits. Doesn’t do any deep scan, doesn’t warn about electrical. Necessary for a trim carpenter, handyman, etc. it’s great. 2 AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: meyerslmt

customer_reviews.title: easiest to use and most accurate ever!
customer_reviews.text: Hung multiple wooden shelves accurately hitting all studs (first time ever that has happened in our house). Would recommend but costs a little more but really worth it (not having to patch and paint "misses" with the less robust stud finders we have used).
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great for finding the center of the stud
customer_reviews.text: This stud finder is almost 100% accurate at finding the center of the stud. The only reason that I did not give it 5 stars, it's because it's not so great at finding the exact width of the stud. Therefore, if you are trying to place two screws in a stud, there is a great change one of them will miss
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Lopez

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good stud finder so I picked the sensor Franklin 710 to find the studs in the bathrooms in order to mount a safety bar it is not very trustworthy, I had to measure and use a finishing nail and hammer to make sure that the reading on the stud finder is right and I find that it's not all accurate you still have to do some searching
customer_reviews.author: jeannot L.

customer_reviews.title: Good for thicker dry wall with plaster - "rock lath" walls
customer_reviews.text: It works better than a run of the mill stud finder on my thick "rock lath" walls. My walls are 3/4 in thick (3/8 inch old fashioned 16" dry wall panels, plus 3/8 inch plaster over that including a hard skim coat on the surface). Magnets couldn't find the nails in the studs either. But this sensor worked very well finding studs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Best stud finder I've ever used, hands down. Not needing to calibrate it is the best thing ever. That being said, a word of caution: a seam in the drywall (where they tape and float) will appear like a 6" wide board, but don't fall for that. Take a small piece of solid copper wire or a small finishing nail or a very small drill bit to double check when in doubt.
customer_reviews.author: J. Deines

customer_reviews.title: SO happy I bought this
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is a lot more expensive than your typical stud finders. But the convenience that comes with this tool is well-worth the cost. I don't think I can go back to using a beeping stud finder after using this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wang

customer_reviews.title: Has been a great unit for me so far
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great for me on a couple projects already: installing a wall mount for a flat screen TV, installing storage racks hanging from the garage ceiling, and installing shelves in the pantry. Some people have complained about false positives - I've seen some as well. I just pull it back and try again. If it still doesn't seem right I move above or below where I was checking and try again. I've never run into a situation where I haven't hit a stud, though, and that's what I wanted. Oh, and the 3 lights thing is great for making sure you hit center of the stud - especially important when you're drilling pilot holes and installing 5/8" lag screws...
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Super, super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used other stud finders that 1) weren't great and 2) were hard to read. This one costs more AND IT'S WORTH IT. Waaaaaaaaaaaaay better stud-finder. Much easier to use/ Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great product, so much that I’m throwing out my old one.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It’s quiet and accurate, even through our old 1950s odd uneven walls. It definitely has its limitations though, I’ve found it cannot recognize 2x2s behind fire rated drywall if the space between the studs is packed with foiled insulating foam board (newly added wall with modern building materials). Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Plaster
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple of stud finders on my plaster walls to no avail. I's say this is as good as it gets on plaster - I did do a couple of passes to confirm results. However Voila it found the studs and no other finder did.
customer_reviews.author: the scot in NJ

customer_reviews.title: This Really Works Through Plaster
customer_reviews.text: Like most who are shopping for one of these, I've used several different types over the years. I was trying to find the joists in a plaster ceiling in an old house, with no luck with my existing device. I decided to try this one because it uses a different approach. You hold this one stationary while it uses a row of sensors to detect different densities, rather than using a single sensor that requires you to slide back and fourth. This one found the joists accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Finally a stud finder that does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have had several over the years and all have been sporadic at being accurate at finding the stud. This unit while it is larger and will take up more space in your tool box it is well worth it. It is higher priced but as they say you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: George S. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: As I said, this is the best one I have purchased, but the said it would work on a ceramic wall, well I would like to see that. I tried it on my ceramic wall in the bathroom with no success, I was very disappointed . It works just fine on walls though.
customer_reviews.author: JCA

customer_reviews.title: BEST stud finder out there
customer_reviews.text: BEST stud finder out there. After trying to go cheap and getting other stud finders, FINALLY something that finds studs through all materials in my house. I can't say enough good things about this design and utility. I hold my leveler on top of it as I press it against the wall and draw a line to help guide the next step of leveling pictures/ shelving. AMAZING PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: David Hendrick

customer_reviews.title: Works well, feels cheap, display isn’t great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but feels cheap especially when it sells for $50. Doesn’t come with a case, but there are 3rd party ones available on Amazon. Also the LEDs bleed into each other’s windows, making reading more difficult than it should be.
customer_reviews.author: K R

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder on the market-period!
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted to remove a hanging rack in our laundry room and install two large cabinets. Used this stud finder to locate all five studs in less than a minute. Then used a finish nail to confirm stud locations. Stud finder was extremely accurate. Best I have ever seen or used in my 20 plus years of doing diy projects. The ease of use and absence of frustration makes it well worth the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Princeton3

customer_reviews.title: Best Stud Finder PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. DO NOT buy anything else. This will tell you exactly where the stud is every time. Shows the edges as well which is fantastic. The lights help a ton to show exact dimension of edge and width of stud for perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Picker

customer_reviews.title: Greatest improved stud finder every made
customer_reviews.text: May be the greatest improvement of the stud sensor that has been made since we went from the little twirling magnet to the battery version. I have at least 3 different stud finders that I have tried to find one that will actually find the studs, much less the center. This one is so easy to use that anyone, even unexperienced people can use it. It is a great improvement in the field of stud finding.
customer_reviews.author: Rogers Holt

customer_reviews.title: disappointed with only two years of use.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this two years, used it occasionally, and it's just stopped working. I take very good care of my tools, and why this stopped is a mystery. I can usually fix tools that have parts break, but can not figure this out. I have an older Zircon that continues to work fortunately. I did not get $50 worth of use from this. There are others with very happy experience with this, so I guess I got an odd unit with a weak solder joint or something somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: TW Barney

customer_reviews.title: amazing! - no more swiss cheese walls
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for about 5yrs and although not perfect, its by far the best stud finder out there. As a remodeler and handyman it has saved me hours of work. One caveat, if you drop it the batteries will fly out of the handle so I tape it down (the black strip that says Franklin sensor). Ha, I guess there's no such thing as the perfect tool.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Cadorette

customer_reviews.title: I had to stop believing stud finders don't work
customer_reviews.text: Stud finders just don't work. That's what I had come to believe after buying several of them over the years that all ended up relegated to the junk drawer. Last year I saw the reviews for this thing on Amazon and I decided to take a chance. To my astonishment, it works, and it works amazingly well. Not only that, but the design and "user interface" are so much better than the popular brand from the hardware stores. There's nothing to it, just hold the button down and slide it horizontally, and the LEDs light up along the top to show the width of the stud.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Stud Finder
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a bunch of different stud finders and this one works better than the others. You can see the studs as you move the finder horizontally across the wall. The scanner illuminates those lights that are directly over the stud and as the scanner is moved different lights are lit. The only problem I ran into which I don't think can be solved is that if you are scanning a wall between rooms and you have blocking installed for the other room (for instance blocking for towel bars in a bathroom) the scanner will see that blocking and give you a false reading. My solution was to just raise the scanner high enough to avoid the blocking.
customer_reviews.author: Pullman Resident

customer_reviews.title: Exactly where is that stud?
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of it (and it didn't take long), I was able to find the approximate left and right edges of the stud by sliding the tool back and forth slowly across the wall. I love that I can locate not just where the stud is, but where it begins and ends, which comes in handy when I am trying to hang something that requires that I put the nail or screw in closer to the edge of the stud. And as I learned from experience, the company stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F.

customer_reviews.title: pls help!!!
customer_reviews.text: anyone knows what this mean? i really really need to put a shelf here but not confident enough to drill a hole because the reading is incomprehensible
customer_reviews.author: chris lai

product_meta.title: Franklin Sensors ProSensor 710 Precision Stud Finder
product_meta.description: The Pros Ensor 710 incorporates innovative stud sensing technology that instantly finds hidden studs. No sliding is required. This patent-pending detector senses the wall in thirteen locations simultaneously, then immediately illuminates the display elements that are in front of a stud. The Pros Ensor 710 is faster, less error prone and more accurate than other products on the market. It is the easy way to find studs. - advanced Multi-Sense technology senses the wall in multiple locations simultaneously and uses data from many readings to accurately determine the position of studs, operates effectively even through difficult architectural construction features (such as wall and ceiling textures, uneven plaster thickness, uneven paint, and difficult wallpaper, thick walls, etc. ) that can cause other detectors to fail. - bright LEDs lights illuminate to indicate the position of hidden objects – making it very easy to visualize the position of studs. - The only stud Finder available that does not require swipes across a wall to determine the location of studs, so that the readings are immediately accurate. - identifies the width of hidden objects so that you not only know the position of hidden objects, but so you also know the size of them. - can identify the position of multiple studs simultaneously. This is particularly useful for when there might be two or more studs in close proximity, which can often confuse conventional stud finders. - The Pros Ensor 710 has more sensor pad area than conventional stud finders and can sense more accurately through many real-world architectural features such as texturing, uneven plaster thickness, uneven paint, difficult wallpaper patterns, etc. - deep scanning is always active (up to 1. 5"). - The Pros Ensor 710 can be initialized at any position along a surface. - ergonomic soft grip.
feature_bullets: Uses Multi-Sense Technology to find studs more accurately through difficult surfaces.
Instantly finds wood studs, metal studs and other hidden objects.
One-step operation: Press button to turn on. LED lights instantly indicate the location of objects.
Can detect multiple objects simultaneously and identify object width.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars4,459 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
